taxon_name.authority: Brotherus in H. G. A. Engler et al.
(Sullivant) Sullivant in W. S. Sullivant and C. L. Lesquereux

place_of_publication.publication_title: in W. S. Sullivant and C. L. Lesquereux, Musc. Bor.-Amer., sched.

bio:treatment.description: Plants elliptic to globose, occasionally three-angled, 1–1.5 mm. Stem leaves awned, broadly channeled; laminal cells papillose abaxially. Seta as long as the diameter of the capsule. Spores spheric, 35-40 µm, papillose.
Ariz., Ill., Iowa, Kans., Tex.; Mexico (Nuevo León).
bio:treatment.discussion: Acaulon schimperianum is awned and the distal margins are more strongly dentate than those of the other species.

references.reference: Crum, H. A. and L. E. Anderson. 1965. The taxonomy and distribution of Acaulon schimperianum. Bryologist 68: 208–211.
